Windows¶

VLC on Windows¶

  1. Download the VLC installer for Windows.

  2. Once it is downloaded, double click on the file to begin the installation process. This will only take a minute.

Note

If you’re using Windows Vista, 7, 8 or 10 and have UAC (User Account Control) enabled, the operating system may prompt you to grant VLC administrator permissions. Click Yes to continue the installation process.

  1. Before you can continue, you must select the language that you want the installer to use to display information to you. After you select a language, click OK.

  2. The VLC installer recommends that you close all other applications before continuing the installation process. When you’re ready to proceed with the installation process, click Next

  3. Use this menu to customize your install. Choose all of the components you wish to install and whether you want VLC to be your default media player or not. Once you are done, click Next.

  4. Click Browse to choose the destination installation folder. After you’ve identified the desired folder, click Install.

  5. Wait as VLC is installed on your machine. It shouldn’t take too long. Then click Show details to see more information about the progress of the installation.

  6. Once the installation is complete, you may choose to run VLC or read VLC’s release notes. Click Finish to complete the installation process and close the installer.
